titleStmt.title: E. Y. Parsons et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5198

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To His Excellency, W. E. Bramlette, Govenor of Kentucky:

Your Petitioners respectfully represent that at the June Term of the Henderson Circuit in 1863, a Bill of Indictment was found against Joseph C. Price on a charge of assault and battery, and warrant issued for his arrest. When arrested the Sheriff allowed him to give bail in the sum of One Hundred Dollars for his appearance at the next December term of said court. He gave a bond for that amount endorsed by E. W. Fray & John H. Jennings: That at the December term, 1863, in accordance with the bond the said Price did appear at court, -- that the trial did not come off and Price then went into the army and he is now in Indiana. The said Price not being here to attend court; judgment will be taken on the said bond, at ^the^ term now in session. Your petitioners respectfully ask that Your Excellency so far interpose your clemency as to remit that proportion of said forfeiture as would go to the Commonwealth and release the said for Fray and Jennings from the payment of the same.

Very respectfully yours &c
E. Y. Parsons.
Harvey Geaman
Jacob Held sr.
R. P. Latcher
W. S. Hicks
John McBride
A G Dennis
Thos S Johnson
Wm. W. Catlin
Jno Barns
E. D. McBride
Thos. F. Cheaney
Jas F Clay
Chas Eaves
Jno B Allin
Wm. F. Quinn

G. W. Watkins
R. Seet
A. C. Voris
Will. P. Beverley
Alex: Rankin
J W Crockett Personally I have no knowledge of the facts but from what I regard reliable information I believe they are true a therefore sign the petition
A I Nunn.
Cann a J W C
John ^his Mark^ Rinster
E. W. Warsham
Wm. W. Huston
W P Churchill
